adjectives.description: unfavourable (comparative more unfavourable, superlative most unfavourable) (British spelling)

entries.meaning: Serving to hinder or oppose; adverse, disadvantageous, inconducive, unsuitable.

examples: Synonyms: inauspicious, unfortunate; see also Thesaurus:unlucky
Antonyms: favourable, fortunate; see also Thesaurus:lucky

entries.meaning: Of a belief, state of mind, etc.: not favourable; disapproving.
Of wind or weather: causing delay or obstacles; not conducive to travel or work; inclement.
examples: The wind was right under the land, the tide unfavorable.
